page.title: 16The Climate of Fraserburgh
page.content: Despite its apparently exposed location at the extreme north-easterly tip of the Buchan area, Fraserburgh clearly benefits from its proximity to the Moray Firth with its relatively mild climate. The sea air prevents snow from lying for long in winter and the annual average temperature is high enough to let farmers harvest their barley up to two weeks ahead of the people of central Buchan, just 20 miles inland but a few hundred feet above sea-level. The summer sees holiday-makers enjoying the sand and sea at Fraserburgh Bay whilst staying at the Links caravan site or at a boarding house or hotel. The waves at the beach are often of such size as to provide good surfing conditions.
